problem_text:
A finite group G is called weakly ab-maximal if |H : [H, H]| ⩽|G : [G, G]| for all H ⩽G. Do weakly ab-maximal groups have bounded derived length?
It is known that weakly ab-maximal groups are direct products of weakly ab-maximal p-groups (F. Lisi, L. Sabatini, J. Group Theory, 27 (2024), 1203–1217).
L. Sabatini
